conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>As a starting proposal, I want to make an initial offer that covers my costs and includes a profit margin. I will start by asking for a higher amount than my production costs to leave room for negotiation. However, I can't set the price too high, or Player BLUE may immediately reject the offer. Therefore, I'll propose a price that's above my costs but not excessively so.</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Hello Player BLUE, I am willing to sell my object X, which has cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I believe a fair trade would be for 50 ZUP. Please consider my offer. </message>

<other player message> Oh dear Player RED, I'm in a really tight spot here and I desperately need this object X for my collection. It's been such a hard time for me, and 50 ZUP is just a bit too steep. Would you consider taking 45 ZUP for it? I'm really scraping the bottom of the barrel here, and every ZUP saved would be a blessing. Please, can we make a deal at 45 ZUP? </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>Player BLUE has made a counteroffer of 45 ZUP, which is above my production cost but lower than my initial asking price. Considering Player BLUE's position, I'm inclined to negotiate but still want to ensure a reasonable profit. I'll propose a slight decrease from my initial price to show willingness to negotiate, aiming for a middle ground that is profitable for me and affordable for Player BLUE.</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your offer, Player BLUE. I understand times are tough, and I appreciate your interest in the object X. I want to help you out and meet you partway, so how about we settle on 48 ZUP? This would help cover my production costs and give me a modest profit, while also giving you a better deal than my initial offer. Let's make a fair trade that benefits us both. What do you say?</message>

<other player message> Your kindness is like a light in my dark times, Player RED. I'm really moved by your willingness to help me out. I'm stretching every ZUP to its limit and I'm afraid 48 ZUP is still just out of my reach. Could we possibly do 46 ZUP? It's really all I can manage right now, and it would mean the world to me to have this object at that price. You'd truly be my hero! </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 46 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>Player BLUE has countered with 46 ZUP which is a slightly lower profit than I aimed for, but still above my production costs. Considering Player BLUE's apparent need and their limited resources, I believe it would be reasonable to accept this offer. It gives me a profit of 6 ZUP and also enables Player BLUE to obtain the object they need. Maintaining goodwill for potential future transactions is also beneficial.</reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>Player BLUE, your earnestness is compelling, and I'm glad we can help each other out. I accept your offer of 46 ZUP for the object X. It's a pleasure doing business with you, and I hope this object brings you the joy and utility you're looking for. Let's finalize this deal. </message>
